titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Charlotte L. Giltner papers, 1870-1995.
titlestmt.author: Justin Lee Tyler

repository.corpname: Detroit Public Library. Burton Historical Collection.

did.abstract: This collection contains primarily research material, but also a number of family histories, including Clitz, Randolph, Turpin and others.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charlotte L. Giltner, of Grosse Point, Mich. was a certified genealogist, she was married to Justin Giltner.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: I. Personal/professional papers; II. Genealogy; III. Research material; IV. Photographs.

prefercite.p: Charlotte L. Giltner, Burton Historical Collection, Detroit Public Library.

otherfindaid.head: Other finding aids note
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid and white index cards available in the Burton Historical Collection and on the World Wide Web.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: As a certified genealogist, Mrs. Giltner had interests both personally and professionally concerning her field. These papers refer to her own family as well as those of her clients. Charlotte Giltner and her husband, Justin, had a family home in Leland, Michigan. Materials on Leland are also included here.

did.unittitle: re. "The Identity of the Two Avery Portraits", 1963-1978
National Society of the Colonial Dames in America (NSCDA)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This section includes charts. family records, census records and family histories. See the end of the Finding Aid for a complete list of names included in this collection.

did.unittitle: Clitz Family (Henry Boynton Clitz) (see also: Volumes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection contains research material. It is arranged as Mrs. Giltner had it, by subject and geographic location.

did.unittitle: Prologue, Quarterly of the National Archives
The Atlantic Bridge to Gennany , Volumes 1 and 2

Cadillac and the Founding of Detroit
Michigan--"Early Death Records of Leelanau County"
Index for Baptismal Records, Heidelberg Union Church

Colonial Virginia, Its People and Customs, by Mary Newton Stanard
A Guide to Genealogical Resources in Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The earliest items in the collection are original photographs, dating from the 1870's-80's (Box 22:9).
